conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: extruded walls with thickness, visible wall top/side faces, perceptible room volumes, and an angled/isometric viewpoint with the ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with consistent wall height/thickness and readable interior volumes; cutaway is clean. Minor simplification of some corner/partition geometry and opening details.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches the 2D plan well (garage on right, central hall/circulation, kitchen/living/nook cluster on left/top, bedrooms grouped). Some internal partition lengths/angles and a few doorway/opening positions appear simplified compared to the plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures are present in key areas (beds, dining table, living seating, kitchen counters, bathroom fixtures). A few rooms are more sparsely or generically furnished than implied by the plan, and some placements look approximate.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is clean and readable with consistent materials and lighting. Minor presentation issue: visible text label on the model floor (e.g., patio text) reduces presentation cleanliness.

detected_errors.description: Some door/window opening placements and proportions appear simplified and may not perfectly match the 2D plan.
Minor-to-moderate layout fidelity drift in a few internal partitions/corner angles (e.g., hall/bath/utility cluster and some angled walls) compared to the 2D drawing.
Text label visible on the 3D model surface (e.g., 'COVERED PATIO'), reducing presentation cleanliness per rubric.

summary: A clearly valid isometric cutaway 3D conversion with strong overall plan fidelity, with only moderate simplification in some partitions and minor door/window and presentation-text issues.
